{"step_by_step_thinking": "The periodontal ligament is a specialized connective tissue that attaches the cementum of a tooth to the alveolar bone. It does not derive its blood supply primarily from the branches of vessels entering the pulp, so option A is incorrect. The periodontal ligament has a high rate of turnover due to the constant mechanical forces it experiences, so option B is incorrect. It is primarily composed of type 1 collagen, not type 2, so option D is incorrect. The periodontal ligament does contain epithelial cells of Malassez, which are remnants of Hertwig's epithelial root sheath that are involved in the formation of the root.", "answer_choice": "C"}
